intro: Trisetopsis lachnantha, commonly known as the silky trisetopsis, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant is notable for its soft, silvery foliage, which gives it its common name. It produces small, yellow flowers arranged in dense clusters, often blooming in late spring to early summer. Trisetopsis lachnantha is typically found in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to dry, coastal environments.
